GOD.content: tremble in fear of unpredictable, unforeseeable, the untouchability of the arrival (tremo, tromeō, tromos, tremendus), enigma of trembling and tears, what are they metaphors or figures for?

R.content: democracy opens public space by granting change of tone (Weschsel der Töne), irony as well as fiction, simulacrum, secret, literature > this undecidability [“I continue to believe”] only radical possibility of letting/thinking what comes about by arriving of whoever arrives [see p. 87]

MONL.content: desire is borne by the arrival itself, before ipseity (I-me)

H.content: law of hospitality commands host gives arrivant, “new arrival,” an unconditional welcome; no anticipation

MC.content: I address you w/out knowing you, something arrives [Nietzsche’s future philosophers]

BL.content: text [Kafka’s] jealously guards its inconsistent content, brings reader before the law > endless differance until death
neither arrives no lets anyone arrive

SPOM.content: Marx’s legacy: the absolute and unpredictable singularity of the arrivant as justice, messianic: ineffaceable mark of Marx’s legacy

A.content: absolute arrivant: singularity of “who” arrives or neutrality of that which arrives
affects (brings to light) experience of threshold before one knows if there’s been a call, nomination or promise (Verheissung, Heissen, etc.)
not an invader, invasion presupposes some self-identity, arrivant does not cross a threshold separating two identifiable borders
no more commands than commanded by memory of originary event
as disarmed as a newly born child (p. 34) [Nietzsche]
where archaic is bound to final extremity (telos, eskhaton)
border most difficult to delineate: that the arrivant makes possible everything it cannot be reduced to
border of absolute arrivant keeps one from discriminating btwn figures of arrivant > the dead, the revenant (the ghost, he or she that returns)
triple transitivity of s’attendre: 1) oneself 2) arrivant, the other 3) await each other, which is immediately consonant w/ reference to tout autre [cf. HST p. 360]

trace borders to mark and at same time erase these lines, which only succeed in erasing themselves (n’arrivent qu’à s’effacer), trace to introduce their impossibility, principle of ruin, their chance, promises the line while compromising it in parasitage, grafting, divisibility

PAS.content: what arrives would always arrive at edge (au bord), shore (rive), [death], the impossible arrival of viens
it’s on the border that everything arrives, just misses arriving, or misses le bord d’arriver > il n’y a pas de bord en soi [there’s no border in itself]

P.content: free, vague, wild, pure beauty, indefinite errance: elle ne s’arrive pas à sa destination

POOF.content: democracy counts votes & subjects, but doesn’t/shouldn’t count ordinary singularities: no numerus clausus for arrivants
perhaps as arrivant, arrivant of perhaps: at last the thought of perhaps (will come)

Derrida countersigns Nietzsche [re: arrivant thinkers, new philosophers], extends the duty to countersign again, to us, to me, to you, teleiopoetically: friendship w/out friendship of friends of solitude

ROP.content: Lacan speaks of the insuccès—Derrida transforms it: “l’insuccès qui échoue à arriver” > playing w/ syntax of to: 1) I do not arrive 2) I fail to arrive because I arrive

RM.content: Being’s inscription n’arrive qu’à s’effacer, cf. differance/trace
le trait, il arrive à s’effacer dans un autre, reinscribing itself heterologically, allegorically

TR.content: the 2 meanings of arriver: 1) event that happens to someone 2) message that arrives—or doesn’t arrive at destination, or at some unforeseeable addressee > this singular instability plays w/ its own automatism, never spontaneously interrupted [?] [privileged access to machine effect]

PSSS.content: arrivant, hospitality of visitation not invitation, beyond all instituting utterances, ce qui arrive, event, puts to rout performative act, sometimes cruelly, perhaps beyond the death drive, exceeds rules of hospitality: unpredictable for hosts
the who and the what of what arrives, the arrivant, the event, makes outdated in advance the question about it that always comes too late

+R.content: polysemia or even dissemination drags Adami’s sentence far from any shore (rive), preventing any event from ever arriving (s’arriver)
double ladder, erected, riveted, shackled, never arrives > steps: symbolic of sexual act

LI.content: [re: neologism texter] signature, événement qu’on texte: process of iteration, like surnombre [of Dissemination], marks pluralization that fractures the event, the unique, while causing it to occur (arriver)

TN.content: shouldn’t sense of touch touch us, for something to come about at last (pour que quelque chose arrive enfin), an event, as some say, fatiguing us a little, a singular event (!!) [: )]?
as if idea of simultaneity/continuity born in contact w/ contact btwn 2 points of contact

AD.content: “to say yes at the moment of a separation, indeed of a departure that is not the contrary of an arrival—is it not this deference that inspires the breath of an à-Dieu?”

CF.content: city of refuge giving place for reflection and for new order of law, democracy to come (if a certain idea of cosmopolitanism has arrived, perhaps one hasn’t recognized it yet)

BSi.content: [vis-à-vis Celan] poetry as way, step, coming of event, arrival

UWC.content: techno-scientific virtualization of work, the putting-into-common, any “community” [Aristotle’s city] > mutation of taking place of event, of oeuvre—that which arrives

SPEC.content: postal relay (relais) makes it possible for letter not to arrive, divides structure of letter from outset (d’entrée), neither relay nor analysis if letter were indivisible & always arrived

Freud’s auto-affective structure of time, life as the auto-affection of death, differance lodged in desire (desire nothing but this) for this auto-tely: auto-delegates & arrives only by differing in tout autre [for Freud, life-death announced to serve the proper, an economy of death]

“set (ensemble)” of stricture, a unity that’s not subject/consciousness, begins by binding itself (se-lier) in differential relation w/ itself—it destines itself (se destine), which doesn’t mean: il arrive

FV.content: for Lacan, signifier’s materiality (not empirical) due to certain indivisibility and locality (found where it isn’t) > indivisibility & locality are indissociable—rivet us (nous river), make us arrive at that which properly links singular to signature: guarantee of unity of signifier
for Derrida, letter can always not arrive > Lacan’s symbolic, Lacan’s castration, protects letter from its divisibility/fragmentation
for Lacan, letter’s destiny is arrival at destination
even when letter arrives, its capacity not to arrive torments it, affects “subject,” “character,” “position” [w/ divisibility]
